spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout roughly matches (open lounge/dining at left, kitchen central/top, bath+WC central/bottom, two bedrooms right, detached garage). However several openings do not match the 2D plan: the dining-to-hall connection appears as an open passage in 3D where the plan indicates a hinged door; WC door location/orientation appears different (plan shows WC accessed from the hall with a different swing/face than the 3D); laundry/robe partitioning and access looks reinterpreted (3D reads more like an open alcove rather than the plan’s tighter service core). Balcony/glazing length also appears extended relative to the plan’s indicated opening. Room proportion balance (especially living zone vs service core) is somewhat distorted.

structural_fidelity.notes: Primary adjacencies are mostly preserved (kitchen adjacent to living; bath and WC off hall; bedrooms off hall; garage detached). Wall thickness looks consistent and doors are generally embedded in walls. Main structural deviations are in internal opening definitions: missing/changed door at dining-to-hall, WC access/swing mismatch, and altered service-core subdivision (laundry/robe). No clear additional rooms beyond those in the plan; no clear room omissions observed.

furniture_mapping.notes: The 2D plan provides no furniture layout, yet the 3D includes multiple furniture pieces (sofa set, beds, etc.). Placement/scale cannot be validated against the plan and should be treated as largely invented content for verification purposes; some items also risk misrepresenting circulation widths near doors.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric view is coherent and readable; lighting is even and geometry is generally clean. Minor issues: elements read slightly simplified (door leaves/walls), and some openings/glazing proportions look inconsistent with the plan. Overall clarity is good with minimal rendering artifacts.

detected_errors.description: Dining-to-hall opening is represented as an open passage in the 3D where the 2D plan indicates a hinged door (door omitted/changed at the living/dining–hall threshold).
WC door placement/orientation does not match the 2D plan (access face/swing appears different in the 3D compared to the hall-access configuration shown on plan).
Laundry/robe service-core partitioning and access appear reconfigured (3D depicts a more open/altered alcove arrangement versus the tighter labeled L'dry + robe zone in the plan).
Balcony-side glazing/opening appears longer/more continuous in the 3D than suggested by the 2D plan, indicating exterior opening proportion distortion.
Living/dining area to service-core proportion balance appears inflated in 3D relative to the plan (service core reads compressed).
Furniture is added in 3D despite not being specified in the 2D plan (sofa set, beds, etc.), making interior mapping largely non-verifiable and effectively hallucinated for strict verification.
